perturbation.original_text: This agreement shall renew automatically each year thereafter, unless either party serves written notice of its intention not to renew, on the other at least 90 days prior to the expiration of the then current term of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement shall renew automatically each year thereafter, unless either party serves written notice of its intention not to renew, on the other at least 15 days prior to the expiration of the then current term of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The modification reduces the notice period for non-renewal to 15 days. New York law, which governs the contract according to section 11, might require a longer notification period for automatic renewal clauses to be enforceable, especially in contracts with small businesses or consumers. A 15-day notice period may be deemed unreasonable and thus conflict with New York's general contract law principles of fairness and reasonable notice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York General Obligations Law ยง 5-903, regarding automatic renewal clauses requiring specific notice periods. Common law principles of reasonable notice for contract termination or non-renewal, as interpreted by New York courts.

perturbation.changed_text: Once the common stock has been registered, or, after the one year period applicable under Rule 144, whichever occurs first, the Company at its sole cost and expense have its attorney issue an opinion letter for removal of the legend and release all stock transfer instructions on the common stock, except as maybe required under Rule 144. In the event the Company fails to have its attorney issue the required opinion letter within 5 days of a written request from YourNetPlus.com or its nominee, the Company shall be liable for liquidated damages in the amount of 50% interest per 7 days on the value of the shares based on the closing bid price of the Company's common stock on the 5th business day following the date it receives written notice from YourNetPlus.com or their nominee. perturbation.explanation: The original contract provides 20 days for the company's attorney to issue an opinion letter and stipulates a 10% interest penalty per 30 days for failure to comply. The change reduces the timeframe to 5 days and increases the penalty to 50% interest per 7 days. This could be deemed an unreasonably short timeframe and an excessive penalty, potentially violating New York law regarding liquidated damages. New York courts often scrutinize liquidated damages clauses to ensure they are not punitive and bear a reasonable proportion to the probable loss.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York law on liquidated damages, which requires that such damages be a reasonable estimate of the actual loss and not a penalty. The modified clause may be considered an unenforceable penalty due to the short timeframe and high penalty.

perturbation.original_text: Any controversy or claim arising out of, relating to or in connection with this Agreement that has not been resolved through the informal mediation of the parties shall be resolved through arbitration pursuant to the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association then in effect, as modified by the terms set forth below: (a) the arbitration shall be conducted in New York state; (b) the arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator selected by the parties; (c) the parties shall act in a commercially reasonable manner and speedily select and then conduct the arbitration within 45 days with the expenditure of minimal discovery efforts and expense which shall be determined, if necessary, by the arbitrator. The agreement to arbitrate shall be specifically enforceable under prevailing New York law.
perturbation.changed_text: Any controversy or claim arising out of, relating to or in connection with this Agreement that has not been resolved through the informal mediation of the parties shall be resolved through arbitration pursuant to the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association then in effect, as modified by the terms set forth below: (a) the arbitration shall be conducted in New York state; (b) the arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator selected solely by the Provider; (c) the parties shall act in a commercially reasonable manner and speedily select and then conduct the arbitration within 15 days with the expenditure of minimal discovery efforts and expense which shall be determined, if necessary, by the arbitrator. The agreement to arbitrate shall not be specifically enforceable.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text changes the arbitration clause in several ways that could make it unconscionable or unenforceable under New York law. Specifically, allowing the Provider to unilaterally select the arbitrator creates bias, and reducing the arbitration timeframe to 15 days is unreasonably short. Moreover, stating that the agreement to arbitrate is 'not specifically enforceable' contradicts standard arbitration practices and legal principles, rendering the entire clause questionable under New York contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York law on arbitration agreements, including principles of fairness, impartiality, and enforceability. Case law on unconscionable contract terms, particularly regarding arbitration clauses with biased selection processes and unreasonably short timeframes.
